meanings.definition: In a permanent or essential manner
meanings.sent1: She was inherently kind, always helping others without expecting anything in return.
meanings.sent2: The laws of physics are inherently true and do not change over time.
meanings.sent3: His love for ice cream was inherently strong, leading him to eat it even in the coldest weather.
meanings.sent4: The bond between the twins was inherently unbreakable, like a chain forged from steel.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of nature is inherently captivating, drawing people in with its wonders.

meanings.definition: In a way that is intrinsic or innate
meanings.sent1: The artist was inherently talented, creating masterpieces effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: Cats are inherently curious creatures, always exploring their surroundings.
meanings.sent3: His fear of heights was inherently irrational, considering he lived on the ground floor.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song was inherently soothing, calming even the most restless minds.
meanings.sent5: The bond between siblings is inherently special, built on years of shared experiences.
